intro: Lepanthes aures-asini, commonly known as the golden-veined orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that display vibrant yellow and green hues. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are borne on slender, erect stems and are often clustered in small inflorescences. The orchid's botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
